title: Ticket #1351: Allow file transfer plugins to work with vm universe
description:
Several of our users have requested the ability to pre-stage VM images on execute machines. Currently, the code assumes the image files are visible on the submit machine (and may be accessible on the execute machine via a shared file system). We can support pre-staging fairly easily use the file transfer plugins and the file:// URL type. Some changes need to be made, mainly with the vmware_dir submit attribute.

Milestones

  • Make vmware_dir optional DONE
  • Test using file transfer plugins with vm universe jobs DONE

Details

For VMWare jobs, the user specifies vmware_dir (a required attribute), which points at the directory containing all of the files that describe the image. condor_submit grovels around in that directory for several files, which are then used to set several attributes in the job ad:

  • VMPARAM_VMware_VMX_File = <.vmx file>
  • VMPARAM_VMware_VMDK_Files = <list of .vmdk files>
  • Add the above files and nvram to TransferInputFiles

We should make vmware_dir optional. If it's given, all of the appropriate files are added to TransferInputFiles by condor_submit. If it's not given, then the user needs to list all of the files in transfer_input_files, possibly as URLs. condor_submit can then search TransferInputFiles and set the other job attributes.
